title: How to Add a New Bot in Counter Strike

steps.title: Open Counter Strike:
steps.content: Open Counter Strike: Global Offensive. CS: GO has a built-in offline mode you can use to play bot matches.

steps.title: Click PLAY.
steps.content: Click PLAY . It's in the top-left corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click OFFLINE WITH BOTS.
steps.content: Click OFFLINE WITH BOTS . You'll find this in the PLAY drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select a map.
steps.content: Select a map. Click the map you want to use, then click GO in the bottom-right corner.

steps.title: Choose bot difficulty.
steps.content: Choose bot difficulty. Click a circle in the pop-up window, then click GO . The left-most circle pertains to easy bots, while the right-most circle pertains to the hardest bots.

steps.title: Select a team.
steps.content: Select a team. Click either COUNTER-TERRORISTS or TERRORISTS to join the selected team.

steps.title: View your teams.
steps.content: View your teams. Pressing the Tab ↹ key will show the existing team members (all of whom are bots).

steps.title: Use the developer console to add or remove bots.
steps.content: Use the developer console to add or remove bots. If you have the developer console enabled for CS: GO, you can add or remove bots by pressing ~ and entering the following: Add a bot — Type in bot_add_ct (Counter-Terrorists) or bot_add_t (Terrorists), then press ↵ Enter . Remove a bot — Type in bot_kick_ct (Counter-Terrorists) or bot_kick_t (Terrorists), then press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Open a Counter-Strike game.
steps.content: Open a Counter-Strike game. The following games all support bot additions via console commands: Counter-Strike: Global Offensive Counter-Strike: Source Counter-Strike 1.6

steps.title: Enable the developer console.
steps.content: Enable the developer console. This process will vary slightly depending on your selected game: [1] X Research source Counter-Strike: Global Offensive — Click OPTIONS at the top of the home page, click GAME SETTINGS in the drop-down menu, and switch the "Enable Developer Console" option to "Yes". Counter-Strike: Source and Counter-Strike 1.6 — Click Options , click the Keyboard tab, click Advanced... , and check the "Enable developer console" box.

steps.title: Start a game.
steps.content: Start a game. Either create a new online game, or open your server and connect to it before proceeding.

steps.title: Press the ~ key.
steps.content: Press the ~ key. Doing so will bring up the developer window on the right side of the Counter-Strike screen. The ~ (tilde) key is typically found below the Esc key in the top-left corner of the keyboard.

steps.title: Add a bot.
steps.content: Add a bot. Type in bot_add_ct and press ↵ Enter to add a bot to the "Counter-Terrorists" team, or type in bot_add_t and press ↵ Enter to add a bot to the "Terrorists" team.

steps.title: Change a bot's difficulty.
steps.content: Change a bot's difficulty. Open the console by pressing ~ , then enter in bot_difficulty 1 for easy bots, bot_difficulty 2 for medium bots, or bot_difficulty 3 for expert bots.
